answers.answer: Hello,Since you are having recurrent UTI’s it is advisable for your partner as well to have a vaginal swab done to rule out any infection as well because she may be harboring the infection. Other than that, recurrent urine infections could be due to various reasons.Most common cause is stones in kidney which is blocking urine pathway. Other causes are changing sexual partners frequently, diabetes and of course childhood infections. The urine can also be due to retention of urine anywhere in its flow due t obstruction.The obstruction can be due to abnormality of structures since birth, stones or diseases like tumors. So you should get a ultrasound, CT scan done and also some urine and blood tests like urine culture.Till then drink plenty of fluids and start with the antibiotics after getting a urine culture report to the antibiotics to which the infection is sensitive.I hope it helps. It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided.
